front.title: A modified XML Signature algorithm to mitigate XML Digital Signature wrapping attacks

abstract.t: XML signature standard as described in in RFC3275 [RFC3275] and defined by IETF/W3C references or identifies signed elements by their unique identities as specified by "id" attribute values in the given XML document. Hence, signed XML elements can be shifted from one location to another location in a XML document,and still, it does not have any effect on its ability to verify its signature. This flexibility paves the way for an attacker to tweak original XML message without getting noticed by the receiver. This document proposes to use absolute XPath as an "Positional Token" and modifies XML Signature algorithm to overcome the XML Signature wrapping attacks on XML signatures.
